required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Pharmacokinetics (PK) Study of Single Ascending Doses of CVT-427 (Zolmitriptan Inhalation Powder) In Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 First in Human Open-Label Study of the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Single Ascending Doses of CVT-427 (Zolmitriptan Inhalation Powder) In Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This study is the first study in humans with CVT-427 (zolmitriptan inhalation powder) and is designed to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and PK of single ascending doses of CVT-427 in adult healthy volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objectives:
- To evaluate the overall safety and tolerability of single, inhaled doses of CVT-427 (zolmitriptan inhalation powder) in healthy adults, with special emphasis on cardiopulmonary effects.
- To describe the pharmacokinetics (PK) of single, inhaled doses of CVT-427, Zomig® Tablet, and Zomig® Nasal Spray in healthy adults.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events (AEs) including serious AEs

primary_outcome.time_frame: within 90 min prior to dosing and at specified time points up to 24 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Measured by spirometry using the guideline specified by the Third National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES III)

primary_outcome.time_frame: within 15 minutes pre-dose and at specified time points up to 24 hours post-dose

primary_outcome.measure: Time to maximum observed plasma drug concentration (Tmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 15 minutes pre-dose and at specified time points up to 24 hours post-dose

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration time curve (AUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 15 minutes pre-dose and at specified time points up to 24 hours post-dose
within 15 minutes pre-dose and at specified time points up to 24 hours post-dose

arm_group.description: Periods 1-2: Subjects will receive Zomig oral tablet in Period 1 and Zomig nasal spray in Period 2, 1 hour apart. Periods 3-6: Subjects will receive CVT-427 (dose levels (DL) 1, 2, 3 and 4), administered in ascending order provided that safety and tolerability data are observed to be adequate to allow dose escalation, approximately 24 hours after preceding DL.

intervention.description: Capsules containing zolmitriptan; dose levels equivalent to estimated fine particle dose (i.e., lung-delivered) zolmitriptan.
